intro: Hieracium cornuscalae, commonly known as the Cornuscalae hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in disturbed or marginal environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
